content:
While implementing this operation: http://hl7.org/fhir/capabilitystatement-operation-versions.html
I notice that the output parameters, "version" and "default" are both of type "code".

However, the examples show:
{
"resourceType": "Parameters",
"parameter": [{
"name": "version",
"valueString": "3.0"
}, {
"name": "version",
"valueString": "4.0"
}, {
"name": "default",
"valueString": "4.0"
}]
}

Should the fields be "valueCode" instead of "valueString" since it is a code type? Or should the field type actually be string type?
can you make a task to fix that?
Presumably it should be one of the codes from http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/FHIR-version - so 4.0.1 for the current version of R4.
i think they are purposefully "3.0" and "4.0" so as to match the fhirVersion mime-type parameter values: https://hl7.org/fhir/http.html#version-parameter
My expectation is that they match the Value Set used to populate CapabilityStatement.fhirVersion and not the MIME type parameter. @Grahame Grieve , what's your position on this?

the documentation on the operation is pretty clear:

Use the major.minor version like 3.0
